page.title: 11POST OFFICE,NORTH KYME
page.content: The general store and post office have been in North Kyme since before 1866. The present owners,{Mr.and Mrs Hardman have been there for three years. They live in the house attached to the shop which is more than 180 years old and part of which used to be a baby clothes shop. The house and land is about \ an acre.They get their supplies from a Cash and Carry at Lincoln,their fresh vegetables from Lincoln, and their bread from Tattershall.Most of their trade is from people stopping as they pass buy rather than local people doing their main shopping there.The Post Office is open 5 days a week and the shop open 7.As well as general groceries they sell sweets,milk,fresh and frozen meat,toys,knitting wool, pots and pans, and birthday cards.
